article.headline: Apple's stock rally adding nearly $6 billion to Warren Buffett's wealth
article.body: Warren Buffett has received a lot of criticism recently amid the recent market downturn, but one investment he's got right is Apple Inc.'s stock AAPL, +1.74%. Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. BRK.B, +0.24% BRK.A, +0.06% owned 245,155,566 shares of Apple as of March 31, according to the latest 13-F filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, making it the Apple's second-largest shareholder with 5.73% of the shares outstanding. With Apple's stock up $24.23, or 6.3%, toward a record high on Friday after the technology giant's better-than-expected earnings report, Berkshire Hathaway's share stake is worth $5.94 billion more than it was on Thursday. With the stock up $154.71, or 60.8%, since the end of the March, the stake's value has increased by $37.93 billion. In comparison, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% has rallied 19.3% since the end of March.
